definitions.definition: Having little ambition for success or achievement
The acquisition of a controlling interest in a business or corporation by outright purchase or by purchase of a majority of issued shares of stock.
Toasted bread.
definitions.example: I ate a piece of toast for breakfast.

definitions.definition: A proposed salutation (e.g. to say "cheers") while drinking alcohol.
definitions.example: At the reception, there were many toasts from the well-wishers.

definitions.definition: A person, group, or notable object to which a salutation with alcohol is made; a person or group held in similar esteem.
definitions.example: He was the toast of high society.

definitions.definition: (chiefly US) Something that will be no more; something subject to impending destruction, harm or injury.
definitions.example: If I ever get my hands on the guy that stole my wallet, he’s toast!

definitions.definition: Extemporaneous narrative poem or rap.
A transient, informational pop-up window.
To lightly cook by browning via direct exposure to a fire or other heat source.
definitions.example: We liked to toast marshmallows around the campfire.

definitions.definition: To grill, lightly cook by browning specifically under a grill or in a toaster
definitions.example: Top with cheese and toast under the grill for a few minutes.

definitions.definition: To engage in a salutation and/or accompanying raising of glasses while drinking alcohol in honor of someone or something.
definitions.example: We toasted the happy couple many times over the course of the evening.

definitions.definition: To warm thoroughly.
definitions.example: I toasted my feet by the fire.

definitions.definition: To perform extemporaneous narrative poem or rap.
To cause (something) to become more glad.
To become more glad in one's disposition.
A senior bishop who is in charge of an archdiocese, and presides over a group of dioceses called a province (in Catholicism, Eastern Orthodoxy, Anglicanism, etc.)
One who scalps, or removes the scalp of another.
One who scalps tickets to popular entertainment events: buying them in advance and then selling them (e.g. online or just outside the venue of the event), often at inflated prices.
definitions.example: We could see three different scalpers moving through the crowd outside the arena, each muttering the characteristic refrain: “Need any tickets?”

definitions.definition: A person on an open outcry exchange trading floor who buys and sells rapidly for his or her own account, aiming to buy from a seller and a little later sell to a buyer, making a small profit from the difference (roughly the amount of the bid/offer spread, or less).
A machine for removing the ends of grain, such as wheat or rye, or for separating the different grades of broken wheat, semolina, etc.
A surgical instrument for scraping carious bones.
In eager desire, eager, astir.
(chiefly of eyes) Wide open.
In a state of high anticipation, excitement, or interest.
A particular weight class, or member of such, as prescribed by the rules, between that of the heavier welterweight and the lighter featherweight. See Wikipedia for the specifics of each sport.
A particular weight category as prescribed by the rules, separate from an open or heavyweight class.
A competitive weight division as prescribed by the rules, between the heavier middleweight and the lighter featherweight.
One of little consequence or ability.
A person who cannot handle their drink; one who gets drunk on very little alcohol.
A political candidate with little chance of winning
Lacking in earnestness, ability, or profundity
Having less than average weight
Lacking in strength
Having a small footprint or performance impact
An artificially created or enhanced sound, used to accompany the action of a dramatic production, such as a film, play or video game
Meat from the shoulder of a cow or other animal.
Food.
A mechanical device that holds an object firmly in place, for example holding a drill bit in a high-speed rotating drill or grinder.
To place in a chuck, or hold by means of a chuck, as in turning.
To bore or turn (a hole) in a revolving piece held in a chuck.
A chicken, a hen.
A clucking sound.
A friend or close acquaintance; term of endearment.
definitions.example: Are you all right, chuck?

definitions.definition: To make a clucking sound.
To call, as a hen her chickens.
A gentle touch or tap.
definitions.example: She gave him an affectionate chuck under the chin.

definitions.definition: A casual throw.
A throw, an incorrect bowling action.
An act or instance of vomiting.
On rhythm guitar or mandolin etc., the muting of a chord by lifting the fretting fingers immediately after strumming, producing a percussive effect.
To touch or tap gently.
To throw, especially in a careless or inaccurate manner.
definitions.example: Chuck that magazine to me, would you?

definitions.definition: To throw; to bowl with an incorrect action.
To discard, to throw away.
definitions.example: This food's gone off - you'd better chuck it.

definitions.definition: To jilt; to dump.
definitions.example: She's chucked me for another man!

definitions.definition: To vomit.
To leave; to depart; to bounce.
definitions.example: Let's chuck.

definitions.definition: To chuckle; to laugh.
On rhythm guitar or mandolin etc.: to mute a chord by lifting the fretting fingers immediately after strumming, producing a percussive effect.
A rodent of the family Sciuridae, belonging to the group of large ground squirrels known as marmots, Marmota monax.
A small pebble.
(in the plural) Money.
A weariness caused by exertion; exhaustion.
(often in the plural) A menial task or tasks, especially in the military.
Material failure, such as cracking or separation, caused by stress on the material.
To tire or make weary by physical or mental exertion
To wilt a salad by dressing or tossing it
To lose so much strength or energy that one becomes tired, weary, feeble or exhausted
(of a material specimen) to undergo the process of fatigue; to fail as a result of fatigue.
The technique or practice of applying and manipulating paint (usually oil or gouache) in a painting.
definitions.example: The fake was easy to spot because of its inferior brushwork.

definitions.definition: An operation to graft a piece of skin, moving it from one place to another, a dermoplasty.
A piece of skin grafted during such a surgery.
A person who selects, or plays music videos either on television or at a disco.
The study of rhythm, intonation, stress, and related attributes in speech.
The study of poetic meter; the patterns of sounds and rhythms in verse.
A table, usually in a dining room, on which meals are served.
The sound produced by a typical car horn.
The cry of a goose.
A bad smell.
To use a car horn.
definitions.example: They stood and observed how long it took for the other cars to honk.

definitions.definition: To make a loud, harsh sound like a car horn.
To make the vocal sound of a goose.
To vomit: regurgitate the contents of one's stomach.
To have a bad smell.
To squeeze playfully, usually a breast or nose.
Imitation of car horn, used, for example, to clear a path for oneself.
(racial slur) A Caucasian person.
A factory hand or general unskilled worker.
A method of management in which instructions are passed to and from one's superior.
Capable of being irritated.
Easily exasperated or excited.
definitions.example: an irritable old man

definitions.definition: Responsive to stimuli.
Serious physical injury to a person, or the fact of causing such injury.
The side of a store (or other shop) which faces the street; usually contains display windows.
(by extension) An e-commerce website offering goods or services to the public.
The act of making unplanned or otherwise spontaneous purchases.
Any metal that has a specific gravity greater than about 5, especially one, such as lead, that is poisonous and may be a hazard in the environment.

A genre descended from rock music, characterized by massive sound, highly amplified distortion, and overall loudness, often with extended guitar solos, and lyrics that involve violent or fantastic imagery.
Guns or shot of large size.
Great influence or power.
An expression suggesting an ultimatum which indicates the listener(s) will either conform to the desires or teachings of the speaker or else be excluded.
The trait of being clever at speaking, often in a deceitful way.
A near relative.
Having the same mother and father; a full (brother or sister).
definitions.example: brother-german

definitions.definition: Being born to one’s blood aunt or uncle, a first (cousin).
definitions.example: cousin-german

definitions.definition: Closely related, akin.
definitions.example: Wert thou a leopard, thou wert german to the lion.

definitions.definition: An elaborate round dance, often with a waltz movement.
A social party at which the german is danced.
A computerised image of a suspect produced for the police force.
A piece of playground equipment consisting of a set of interlinked bars on which children can climb.
A wind blowing from the south.
Coming from the south.
definitions.example: Warm, moist air was brought by southerly winds

definitions.definition: Facing the south; directed towards the south.
Located towards the south
In a southward direction or position; (towards the) south.
From the south.
A homeless person who sleeps outdoors.
A carefree or aimless gait; a stroll.
To walk unsteadily, as a small child does.
To walk in a carefree manner.
definitions.example: There he was, just toddling along.

definitions.definition: To limp; move with a limping gait.
To stand in doubt whether to proceed, or what to do; hesitate; be uncertain; linger; delay; mammer.
To be lame, faulty, or defective, as in connection with ideas, or in measure, or in versification.
To waver.
To falter.
To stop marching.
To stop either temporarily or permanently.
To bring to a stop.
To cause to discontinue.
definitions.example: The contract negotiations halted operations for at least a week.

definitions.definition: The action of one who halts; a stopping or hesitancy.
Prone to pauses or breaks; hesitant; broken.
definitions.example: her halting steps

definitions.definition: A vector quantity that denotes the rate of change of position with respect to time, or a speed with the directional component.
Rapidity of motion.
The rate of occurrence.
The number of times that an average unit of currency is spent during a specific period of time.
Any inorganic material containing calcium, usually calcium oxide (quicklime) or calcium hydroxide (slaked lime).
Any gluey or adhesive substance; something which traps or captures someone; sometimes a synonym for birdlime.
To treat with calcium hydroxide or calcium oxide (lime).
To smear with birdlime.
To apply limewash.
A deciduous tree of the genus Tilia, especially Tilia × europaea; the linden tree, or its wood.
Any of several green citrus fruit, somewhat smaller and sharper-tasting than a lemon.
Any of the trees that bear limes, especially Key lime, Citrus aurantiifolia.
A brilliant, sometimes yellowish, green colour associated with the fruits of a lime tree.
A fan fiction story which contains sexual references, but stops short of full, explicit descriptions of sexual activity (coined by analogy with lemon).
Containing lime or lime juice.
Having the aroma or flavor of lime.
Lime-green.
To hang out/socialize in an informal, relaxed environment, especially with friends, for example at a party or on the beach.
A leash.
To carry or have equipped on or about one's body, as an item of clothing, equipment, decoration, etc.
definitions.example: He's wearing some nice pants today.  She wore her medals with pride.  Please wear your seatbelt.  Can you wear makeup and sunscreen at the same time?  He was wearing his lunch after tripping and falling into the buffet.

definitions.definition: To have or carry on one's person habitually, consistently; or, to maintain in a particular fashion or manner.
definitions.example: He wears eyeglasses.  She wears her hair in braids.

definitions.definition: To bear or display in one's aspect or appearance.
definitions.example: She wore a smile all day.  He walked out of the courtroom wearing an air of satisfaction.

definitions.definition: (with "it") To overcome one's reluctance and endure a (previously specified) situation.
definitions.example: I know you don't like working with him, but you'll just have to wear it.

definitions.definition: To eat away at, erode, diminish, or consume gradually; to cause a gradual deterioration in; to produce (some change) through attrition, exposure, or constant use.
definitions.example: You're going to wear a hole in the bottom of those shoes.  The water has slowly worn a channel into these rocks.  Long illness had worn the bloom from her cheeks.  Exile had worn the man to a shadow.

definitions.definition: To undergo gradual deterioration; become impaired; be reduced or consumed gradually due to any continued process, activity, or use.
definitions.example: The tiles were wearing thin due to years of children's feet.

definitions.definition: To exhaust, fatigue, expend, or weary.
definitions.example: His neverending criticism has finally worn my patience.  Toil and care soon wear the spirit.  Our physical advantage allowed us to wear the other team out and win.

definitions.definition: To last or remain durable under hard use or over time; to retain usefulness, value, or desirable qualities under any continued strain or long period of time; sometimes said of a person, regarding the quality of being easy or difficult to tolerate.
definitions.example: Don't worry, this fabric will wear. These pants will last you for years.  This color wears so well. I must have washed this sweater a thousand times.  I have to say, our friendship has worn pretty well.  It's hard to get to know him, but he wears well.

definitions.definition: (in the phrase "wearing on (someone)") To cause annoyance, irritation, fatigue, or weariness near the point of an exhaustion of patience.
definitions.example: Her high pitched voice is really wearing on me lately.

definitions.definition: (of time) To pass slowly, gradually or tediously.
definitions.example: wear on, wear away.  As the years wore on, we seemed to have less and less in common.

definitions.definition: To bring (a sailing vessel) onto the other tack by bringing the wind around the stern (as opposed to tacking when the wind is brought around the bow); to come round on another tack by turning away from the wind. Also written "ware". Past: weared, or wore/worn.
To guard; watch; keep watch, especially from entry or invasion.
To defend; protect.
To ward off; prevent from approaching or entering; drive off; repel.
definitions.example: to wear the wolf from the sheep

definitions.definition: To conduct or guide with care or caution, as into a fold or place of safety.
Damaged and shabby as a result of much use
Having a shape like a rectangle.
Having axes that meet each other with right angles.
The absolute height of a location, usually measured from sea level.
definitions.example: As the altitude increases, the temperature gets lower, so remember to bring warm clothes to the mountains.

definitions.definition: A vertical distance.
The distance measured perpendicularly from a figure's vertex to the opposite side of the vertex.
definitions.example: The perpendicular height of a triangle is known as its altitude.

definitions.definition: The angular distance of a heavenly body above our Earth's horizon.
Height of rank or excellence; superiority.
(in the plural) Elevation of spirits; heroics; haughty airs.
Highest point or degree.
A neurotransmitter found in the locus coeruleus which is synthesized from dopamine.
An automobile body with seats and permanent top like a coupe, and with the top projecting over the driver and a projecting front.
An automobile with such a body.
A luxury sedan or saloon car, especially one with a lengthened wheelbase or driven by a chauffeur.
An automobile for transportation to or from an airport, including sedans, vans, and buses.
An act or instance of gloating.
To exhibit a conspicuous (sometimes malevolent) pleasure or sense of self-satisfaction, often at an adversary's misfortune.
To triumph, crow, relish, glory, revel.
One of a group that acts in harmony; a person who is part of a conspiracy.
Part of a group that agree to do an unlawful or unethical act.
definitions.example: The conspirators were rounded up by the police and arrested.

definitions.definition: Having greed; consumed by selfish desires.
Prone to overeat.
Tending to match as much text as possible.
definitions.example: This regular expression performs a greedy match.

definitions.definition: (of an algorithm) That tries to find the global optimum by finding the local optimum at each stage.
Any system of sustainable agriculture that renews natural resources and enriches local ecosystems.
The design, installation and maintenance of indefinitely sustainable human communities set in balanced ecologies, both urban and rural.
A hind (female deer) in the second year of her age.

A framework of wood or metal placed over the coffin or tomb of a deceased person, and covered with a pall; also, a temporary canopy bearing wax lights and set up in a church, under which the coffin was placed during the funeral ceremonies.
A grave, coffin, tomb, or sepulchral monument.
A bier or handbarrow for conveying the dead to the grave.
A carriage or vehicle specially adapted or used for transporting a dead person to the place of funeral or to the grave.
To enclose in a hearse; to entomb.
The office of a premier or prime minister.
(sporting) The position held by the champion team at the end of a particular season (especially as used in Australian rules football).
An outcast.
A cloud covering all of the sky from horizon to horizon; cloudy.
To overthrow.
To cover with cloud; to overshadow; to darken.
To make gloomy; to depress.
To be or become cloudy.
To transform.
To fasten (sheets) by overcast stitching or by folding one edge over another.
Covered with clouds; overshadowed; darkened; more than 90% covered by clouds.
In a state of depression; gloomy; melancholy.
Leather that has been given a high-gloss, shiny finish.
The day or days (boxing week) following Christmas (December 25th) where stores have large reductions.
(of a disease) Easily transmitted to others.
definitions.example: The flu was so contagious that everybody in town got sick!

definitions.definition: Easily passed on to others.
definitions.example: Wearing jeans was a contagious fad at that time.

definitions.definition: (of a person) Having a disease that can be transmitted to another person.
definitions.example: They were highly contagious, spreading bacteria to other people.

definitions.definition: An assistant referee.
A male line judge.
An official whose primary task is to watch the blue line and determine when there has been an offside.
An official whose primary task is to determine whether there has been a line of scrimmage violation.
A person employed to work on electrical lines; a lineman.
A private in the line.
A dog used to protect a property or its owner.
A small depression or indentation in a surface.
definitions.example: The accident created a dimple in the hood of the car.

definitions.definition: Specifically, a small natural depression on the skin, especially on the face near the corners of the mouth.
definitions.example: You have very cute dimples.

definitions.definition: To create a dimple in.
definitions.example: The hailstorm dimpled the roof of our car.

definitions.definition: To create a dimple in one's face by smiling.
definitions.example: The young girl dimpled in glee as she was handed a cupcake.

definitions.definition: To form dimples; to sink into depressions or little inequalities.

Either of two imaginary lines across the football field touching one of the two apices of the football which point toward either the defensive side or the offensive side before the center is allowed to touch the ball before each play.
The probability that an individual will keep his/her job.
Persons or families that have recently become wealthy.
The decimal monetary system used in the United Kingdom since 1971.
The metric system of measurement, as opposed to the imperial system.
definitions.example: This recipe says add eight ounces of flour; what's that in new money?

definitions.definition: A clip, snippet, passage or extract from a larger work such as a news article, a film, or a literary composition.
To select or copy sample material (excerpts) from a work.
A person who provides tips or advice to others, for example on the form of racehorses or the stock market.
One who provides tips or hints on how to succeed at a game.
A dark brown blemish on the skin, usually caused by exposure to the sun.
A strip of vegetation that differs from its surrounding environment and which connects otherwise separate habitat areas.
A false belief that is resistant to confrontation with actual facts.
The state of being deluded or misled, or process of deluding somebody.
definitions.example: It is far better to grasp the universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring.

definitions.definition: That which is falsely or delusively believed or propagated; false belief; error in belief.
Any group of six people or things.
A composition for six voices or instruments.
A group of six singers or instrumentalists.
An adult linkboy; one bearing a torch or light.
A player who uses speed and dexterity to keep an attacking team's downfield progress fluid.
A man who acts as a link or connection.
A presenter who provides the connecting verbiage between a number of separate items in a broadcast.
A series of illustrations, in sequence, often but not necessarily depicting something funny or satirical in nature.
An interaction between two parties in which information was not communicated as desired.
Paleness; want of color; pallidity; wanness.
definitions.example: pallor of the complexion

definitions.definition: The plant Crocus sativus, a crocus.
A spice (seasoning) and colouring agent made from the stigma and part of the style of the plant, sometimes or formerly also used as a dye and insect repellent.
An orange-yellow colour, the colour of a lion's pelt.
To add saffron to (a food), for taste, colour etc.
definitions.example: saffroned water, saffroned rice.

definitions.definition: To give a saffron colour to (something).
To embellish.
Having an orange-yellow colour.
definitions.example: The saffron robe of a Buddhist monk.

definitions.definition: A political orator or leader who gains favor by pandering to or exciting the passions and prejudices of the audience rather than by using rational argument.
A leader of the people.
To speak or act in the manner of a demagogue; to speak about (an issue) in the manner of a demagogue.
A yellow-coloured card, shown to a player (especially in association football) as a caution that he has committed a flagrant foul; a further such foul would result in a red card.
A card sent out by a travelling dance or theatre company to request temporary personnel from a local labor union.
A yellow ticket.
A traditional (prescientific) faith healer.
A member of certain tribal societies who acts as a religious medium between the concrete and spirit worlds.
An ancient massive construction with a square or rectangular base and four triangular sides meeting in an apex, such as those built as tombs in Egypt or as bases for temples in Mesoamerica.
A construction in the shape of a pyramid, usually with a square or rectangular base.
A solid with triangular lateral faces and a polygonal (often square or rectangular) base.
A medullary pyramid, the medial-most bumps on the ventral side of the medulla oblongata
The game of pool in which the balls are placed in the form of a triangle at spot.
A pyramid scheme.
Alternative letter-case form of Pyramid. (a solitaire card game)
The triangular layout of cards in the game of Pyramid.
definitions.example: Build your pyramid with all cards face down, except the cards in the bottom row.

definitions.definition: An approximately triangular headline consisting of several centered lines of text of increasing length.
To build up or be arranged in the form of a pyramid.
To combine (a series of genes) into a single genotype.
To employ, or take part in, a pyramid scheme.
To engage in pyramid trading.
Selfish, petty; constrained in thought, limited in scope of consideration, not mindful of the big picture.

(Latin American culture) A doll or other decorated container that is filled with candy and hit with a hammer or a stick by blindfolded children during birthday parties or other celebrations until the candy falls out.
Showing clever resourcefulness in practical matters.
Artful, tricky or cunning.
Streetwise.
Knowledgeable, intelligent, keen.
Nigh accurate.
definitions.example: a shrewd guess

definitions.definition: Severe, intense, hard.
definitions.example: a shrewd blow, or assault

definitions.definition: Sharp, snithy, piercing.
definitions.example: a shrewd wind

definitions.definition: Bad, evil, threatening.
Portending, boding.
Noxious, scatheful, mischievous.
Abusive, shrewish.
Scolding, satirical, sharp.
Any of various medical methods and practices used in place of, or as well as, conventional medicine.
The place where sanctified souls are believed to live after death.
definitions.example: Living in paradise comes with a price.

definitions.definition: (Abrahamic religions) A garden where Adam and Eve first lived after being created.
A very pleasant place; a place full of lush vegetation.
definitions.example: an island paradise in the Caribbean; a shoppers’ paradise

definitions.definition: A very pleasant experience.
An open space within a monastery or adjoining a church, such as the space within a cloister, the open court before a basilica, etc.
A churchyard or cemetery.
The upper gallery in a theatre.
To place (as) in paradise.
To transform into a paradise.
To affect or exalt with visions of happiness.
The arched part of the top of the foot between the toes and the ankle.
A section of any footwear covering that part of the foot.
In horses, the hind leg from the ham to the pastern joint.
A skin condition, usually of the face, that is common in adolescents. It is characterised by red pimples, and is caused by the inflammation of sebaceous glands through bacterial infection.
A pattern of blemishes in an area of skin resulting from the skin condition.
(especially Britain) A group of sporting activities including track and field, road running, cross country and racewalking.
(especially US) Physical activities such as sports and games requiring stamina, fitness and skill.
Between sweet and sour taste.
Having both positive and negative traits, or inspiring conflicting good and bad feelings.
A group of often architecturally similar buildings constructed at the same time. Primarily for residential accommodation, estates may also include commercial facilities.
A non-functional but floating ship, usually stripped of rigging and equipment, and often put to other uses such as storage or accommodation.
Any large ship that is difficult to maneuver.
A large structure with a dominating presence.
A big (and possibly clumsy) person.
An excessively muscled person.
To reduce (a ship) to a (nonfunctional) hulk.
To be a hulk, a large (hulking) and often imposing presence.
To move (one's large, hulking body).
To remove the entrails of; to disembowel.
definitions.example: to hulk a hare

definitions.definition: The science that studies the structure of the earth (or other planets), together with its origin and development, especially by examination of its rocks.
The geological structure of a region.
definitions.example: The geology of the Alps.

definitions.definition: A planet which exists outside Earth's solar system.
